data.title: Add titlebar axis control for UIWindow
data.body:
This Pr adds API control of the titlebar axis/location on the UIWindow. The default will be the AXIS_Y, which places the titlebar at the top of the window. The new option is AXIS_X, which moves the titlebar to the left side, the closer 'X' moves to the top of the titlebar, and what's left of the title string is at the bottom, though since Turbobadger can't display rotated text, it quickly clips the string. The resizer still occupies the lower right corner. The DockWindow was also updated with this capability.
This will satisfy a couple of items in #1620  [UI] Turbobadger wishlist (in no particular order)

![window_xy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19511757/29289171-4b58d220-80f0-11e7-86f8-9dd35b63cd54.png)

data.title: Atomic Updates
data.body:
+ C# fix for crashing when running from VS2015/VS2017 (odd issue with not using native debugger engine with managed code)
+ Fix for VS2015 detection when missing trailing slash
+ Quick esc exits for basic JS project templates
+ D3D11 proc sky shader fix
+ Fix for proc sky when autoupdate is not enabled
+ updating submodule commit

data.title: Misc small improvements
data.body:
This is a small collection of recent fixes and few additions. Lets go through them:

CMake version requirement bumped to 3.3. Why you ask? Because noone noticed, but we already depend on that version since we started using `$<$<COMPILE_LANGUAGE:CXX>:-std=gnu++11>`. `COMPILE_LANGUAGE:CXX` thingy was introduced in 3.3. Older distros may get recent prebuilt CMake binaries from CMake website and they run. Tested with CMake 3.9 on ubuntu 14.04 on travis.ci.

Several build fixes for android NDK 13b. Namely must not link to `pthread` because it does not/no longer exists on android. Also wrapped `-std=gnu++11` into generator expression because otherwise compiler fails building c files due to unknown flag. Also excluded profiler tool from build on android in a way that does not cause any warnings.

`ImGui::Text(messageText_.CString());` -> `ImGui::TextUnformatted(messageText_.CString());` because again on android it fails to build due to printing user-supplied text as format string being insecure. Clang is really nice, isnt it? ;)

Added `IntVector2` constructor taking in float array. No explanation needed here.

Added `SetBlockEvents(bool)` and `GetBlockEvents()` to `Object`. This allows us to block certain objects from sending and receiving events. I found it very convenient for implementing game states, but i am sure there are other useful applications. Blocking events is easier than unsubscribing and resubscribing after all.

Added `SendEvent(StringHash, const VariantMap&)` overload which allows us to use initializer lists for sending events. For example `SendEvent("foo", { {Foo::P_BAR, "bar"}, {Foo::P_FOO, 1} })`. While using this method variant causes extra copy i think there should be a convenience method for cases where speed does not matter.

This is a mix of various things, but i think they should be acceptable. If not, and if you think i should split PR up or get rid of some changes please let me know.

data.title: Move imgui ui assembly and rendering to END_RENDERING event.
data.body: Required for interoperability with Urho3D UI. It allows me to render Urho3D UI just before imgui in order to have imgui be rendered on top of everything. It does not affect anything related to TurboBadger, imgui still renders on top of it like before.

data.title: Visual studio already installed but still asking anyway
data.body:
I have Visual Studio 2015 installed along with Xamarin and after building the editor, trying to open the content examples I got this:
![atomiceditor_2017-08-09_12-47-58](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12544505/29135819-0147dbec-7d01-11e7-8217-4749d990016d.png)
Thinking it was just something wrong with the source, I installed build3 and tried all of the csharp projects and creating my own but they all showed the same message. I updated Xamarin, restarted computer, same message. I've had atomic with vs2015 work on a different computer, so I don't think I need to install vs2017.

data.title: [UI] Turbobadger wishlist (in no particular order)
data.body:
- UIScrollContainer doesn't seem to work properly from code (@JimMarlowe gave me an example in TB layout language, I tried to do the same in code, it broke. Possibly due to different defaults and differences in the layout enums?)

- Currently can't set a cursor image

- Window resizing currently only works in BOTH dimensions at once if enabled. Sometimes we want to be able to resize a window in X or Y only.

- The X button just closes the window. It would be good to be able to bind an event to this to allow it to be hidden rather than closed. We could also do with the ability to add other window controls to the header such as minimize and maximize and to set the position of those buttons.

- Turning off the window header just leaves a big useless space at the top - sometimes we want windows without any header at all.

- Combined with the above, sometimes we want to have a drag handle on the side of windows (e.g. skill bars where you can stack them on top of eachother) and we don't want to have any padding at the top.

- It would be good to be able to set windows to snap to a grid, or to edges of the screen or other windows.

- A very useful custom widget would be a grid or table where you can define X rows and Y columns and then assign items to them by X/Y. This would be useful in tons of games for inventories and containers, item shops.

data.title: [Linux] locale issue still present
data.body:
I don't think #1466 solved the locale issues in #710 fully. This is what opening the toon town scen for the second time looks like with Swedish locale.

![screenshot-window-2017-08-06-215244](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9007314/29006498-a26a5b6a-7af1-11e7-82dc-c51643ecad47.png)

To reproduce:
1. start editor with Swedish locale set
2. open scene -> looks OK
3. close scene
4. reopen scene -> looks corrupted

Running the editor with LC_NUMERIC=C solves the issues.

data.title: Add Atomic UIButtonGrid widget
MingW-w64 support
data.body: Engine can now build with MingW-w64. What is still missing is webview and as direct consequence of that - editor. Webview is disabled if mingw is detected. Bindings build though. I also updated nativefiledialog to latest version which already is pretty old. That was required in order to get mingw building. As a consequence of update it is no longer possible to set title of dialog for choosing a directory. I hope it is acceptable.

data.title: Allow Editor Plugins to define shortcuts and some linting
Disable imgui file creation by default.
data.body:
Disable imgui's default behavior of creating an ini and log file.  Also, output to stdout/stderr when running script binding generation

Closes #1595

data.title: Add UIPeriodicTable example
data.body:
This adds the UIPeriodicTable example to the AtomicEditor example browser. 
My Examples submodule isn't updating for the new UIPeriodicTable directory, is there something else I need to do to make that happen?

data.title: Turbobadger TabContainer Docking (continued)
data.body: This is PR https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/pull/1606 with a quick fix to ensure we don't return invalid results.

data.title: Move UI update event to engine post update, cleanups
data.body: Closes #1609

data.title: [Editor] Draggin and Droppen is b0rken
data.body:
In the Editor, dragging and dropping has ceased to function.  By using a binary build search, the breaking commit seems to be ``2cb4ac0 3D UI Feature``  The failure mechanism is the UIDragDrop::HandleMouseDown() is now occurring **before** the HierarchyFrame.handleWidgetEvent() 

The HierarchyFrame.handleWidgetEvent() assigns the drag object to the heirlist.
UIDragDrop::HandleMouseDown() looks up the hoverwidget, and searches the parents for the drag object, now too soon.

data.title: [Editor, Crash] If the Atomic Editor is viewing a scene made in Tiled, and the user edits the file in Tiled, Atomic will crash
data.body:
Windows 10
Atomic Editor Git: 0eeef4bf3997d19bebc9426b7690b0342b4b9ba1
Tiled Version 1.0.2 (Windows x64 build)

Repro steps:
In Atomic, open the 2D Physics Platformer example
Open the scene viewer to view the level design
In Tiled, open the same level design file currently open in Atomic
Make an edit to the level in Tiled and save.

Observed:
Atomic will crash immediately when the updated level design in saved from Tiled.

Notes:
Atomic only crashes if the scene viewer is in use at the time the new file is saved from Tiled

data.title: FBX Import Scaling Issues
data.body: When importing .fbx models, they appear to "grow" being about 300 times as large as when I exported them from blender using meters as the base unit. I'm not sure whether it is Atomic or Blender causing the issues.

data.title: Turbobadger TabContainer Docking
data.body:
This PR adds undocking and redocking for the Turbobadger UITabContainer Widget. For undocking a tab, the page contents can be reparented into a Window (for real!). For redocking, the content is reparented again back into the UITabContainer. A new widget, the UIDockWindow, was created, that can redock with an embedded button in the titlebar.
Added NumChildren to TBWidget, a missing method.
Added PrettyPrint to TBWidget, this has been used to check is the un/redocking was doing what it was suppose to.

data.title: Fix for renderer selection on Windows
data.body: Closes #1602 via #1604, with a comment fix here...

data.title: Fix #1602 for real
data.body: This should solve the issue. Could use a test from someone other than me though :p

data.title: [Windows OpenGL] Windows OpenGL regression (DX11 default)
data.body: Setting DX11 to default has broken OpenGL build switch - you get DX11 whether you like it or not.

data.title: Imposters/Billboards to-do and discussion
data.body:
# **OK the Impostors are usable already, this is pretty much the only tasks that matters at this point:**
- [ ] **Make an ImpostorManager component that creates/manages the ImpostorChunk Drawables and get rid of all the statics and the other bullshit! Expose the hardcoded settings, and maybe try to make it a subsystem and expose in the editor (maybe... *maybe* :trollface:)**

# Generation
- [x] **POSTPONED** ~~generate imposter verts with correct boundaries for object (use aabb proj @ (1,1,1)*thres for max bbs)~~
- [x] generate scaled impostors at the center of the mesh aabb
- [ ] provide alternative projections to maximize texture utilization: no correction, pythagoras, naive
- [ ] render using real alpha (not bg color) and anti-aliasing
- [ ] generate normal maps (how to get normals gbuffer to convert to cam space)?
- [ ] generate shadow maps
- [x] check whether cache exists and skip generation
- [ ] skip ~~top and~~ bottom rows, overflow uv in the shader to compensate - related to the proj from below task
- [ ] 'solidify'/'bleed' imposter textures so it doesn't ipo to black on the borders
- [ ] optionally bake pbr maps like metalness and albedo and use true pbr rendering for imposters (depends on some tasks above)

# General
- [ ] use a separated frustum for the imposters, so we can decrease the normal view frustum far plane distance considerable, so we have less nodes in the frustum to check their distance
- [ ] make it easy to configure draw distance, transition range, uv tiles qty, chunk size (hard coded)
- [ ] optionally pass uv tile qty in the vbo to allow varying tiles in a single texture array
- [ ] provide independent impostor systems for different resolutions because texture arrays aren't jagged, so if object sizes vary a lot, small objects could use smaller textures, e.g: buildings and props like crates
- [ ] temporal transition?
- [ ] provide a better way to configure ambient light and to pass the main light that doesn't require you to pass them for each node
- [ ] check if caches are updated/relevant and not just if they exist

# Aligned
- [x] create discrete chunks of vbos (static)
- [x] pass x, y, z, yangle to the shader TODO: do this properly
- [x] calculate vertices positions in the vertex shader
- [x] calculate uv tile in the vertex shader
- [x] zero vbo vertices of billboards that shouldn't be displayed
- [x] create and dispose vbos
- [x] cull vbos using aabbs
- [x] fix dumb mistake in which we're calculating the imposter rot from the camera quaternion thus causing problems with things like camera shake... either pass a quat specifically for imposter orientation, calculate a y ord quat in the shader (camPos->impPos vec)... or maybe correct camera local z rot
- [x] ~~fix projection directly from below (UV flips, prolly low prior)~~
- [x] **WORKAROUNDED - CUTOUT** fix alpha problem - alpha of impostors is clearing other impostors on the same chunk
- [x] dithered blending so we don't have to deal with sorting
- [x] pass imposter rotation on y in ~~radians~~ *revolutions* in the vbo
- [x] bake object uniform scale in the vbo data
- [x] store and shift origin of the imposter to match object and use aabb to save texture space
- [x] pass texture array layer in the vbo ~~(mask with the above in 32bit)~~
- [x] correct rotation based on euler y angle input so we don't pass a quat in the vbo
- [x] use a 'faderange' or 'fadestart' shader constant in the vertex shader and calculate a 'transition' amount
- [x] use the transition amount in the pixel shader to apply a dither effect

# Planar
Planar billboards for billions of trees seen approximately from the same height (or at least from relatively shallow view angles)
- [x] planar imposter orientation with as few math ops as possible
- [ ] render multiple trees on the same texture, one for each row
- [ ] allow some extra projection heights and skew the top vertices accordingly
- [ ] study advantages of passing a start index for the UV tile so you don't have to map one row per object... maybe use a 'objectColumns' variable instead

# Free Billboards
TODO
- [] **POSTPONED**~~shift quads origins (y) in the vbo static data to correct origins when they're not centered (we need this to use as much space from the texture as possible... generally objects origins are on the center-bottom so if we don't do this we'd lose about half the texture area... there's no correction for X/Z though, so if say the origin of a cube is at one of its vertices it still won't be terribly efficient in terms of texture space.~~
- [] **POSTPONED**~~origin shift in the shader to correct local origin as passed in the vbo~~

# Optimization / Extras
- [] ~~for special usages when chunks should be smaller, merge them together to have a min/max number of imposters (very low priority since it's a very unlikely scenario)~~ UPD: dyn batch works
- [] make sure dynamic batching won't ruin it, some scenarios to check: large vbos being merged, TODO
- Research using sparse virtual textures instead of just texture arrays and page what's needed per chunk

data.title: [Build] Ensure build works when path contains a space on all host platforms
data.body: The build has issues when the repo's local path contains a space, this needs to be fixed.

data.title: Changes conflicting enum names, and removes a badly thought out API call.
data.body: I've had this locally for a while. I'm trying to reconcile the upstream and my local version of Atomic. This fix may resolve some script naming conflicts, if anybody has them.

Looks like there are lint warnings/errors, but I'm not sure if that is what is causing the problems. And at the end of the build is this error:

```
     "C:\Users\cjb86\ROAGO\AtomicGameEngine\Artifacts\Build\Windows\Atomic.sln" (LibCpuId;AtomicNETNative target) (1)
        ->
       "C:\Users\cjb86\ROAGO\AtomicGameEngine\Artifacts\Build\Windows\Source\AtomicNET\NETNative\AtomicNETNative.vcxpro
       j.metaproj" (default target) (5) ->
       "C:\Users\cjb86\ROAGO\AtomicGameEngine\Artifacts\Build\Windows\Source\AtomicApp\AtomicApp.vcxproj.metaproj" (def
       ault target) (37) ->
       "C:\Users\cjb86\ROAGO\AtomicGameEngine\Artifacts\Build\Windows\Source\AtomicTool\AtomicToolCheckScripts.vcxproj.
       metaproj" (default target) (40) ->

        (default target) (71) ->
       (CustomBuild target) ->

       s\Source\AtomicTool\AtomicToolCheckScripts.vcxproj]

    805 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)
```

This is on a clean git pull with no modifications. It built fine a little while ago, so it must've been a recent commit. I installed Typescript 2.4.1 for Visual Studio but I haven't done that for node. Any idea what's going on here?

Thanks,
Christopher

data.title: Updates to TypeScript and Monaco Editor
data.body:
This PR updates TypeScript to version 2.4.1 (see https://blogs.msdn.microsoft.com/typescript/2017/06/27/announcing-typescript-2-4/ )

It also updates the Monaco editor to 0.9 (see https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#090-03072017 )

There were also a few changes to ensure that everything still works.  The main difference was that themes are handled differently under Monaco 0.9.  

Monaco 0.9 also adds a new minimap along the side.

data.title: Busy Indicator while on script editor
data.body:
Blue circle appears when on script editor, After clicking on script editor blue circle appears and sometimes editor flickers, even when switched to other window,  but when script editor is unfocused the blue circle disappear. It doesn't happens with any other software, and CPU consumption is about 0 for this software.

Gif Screen shot
https://postimg.org/image/nukxaqrvl/
